alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 4:40PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG FRONT TO BRING GUSTY WINDS, WARM TEMPERATURES, AND RAIN TO THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA THIS WEEKEND... A strong front will reach the Kuskokwim Delta Saturday afternoon and remain nearly stationary over the region through early Monday morning. Strong winds will arrive first early Saturday afternoon with gusts up to 50 mph possible along the coast and near 40 mph farther inland. The strong southerlies will quickly increase temperatures into the mid-to-upper 30s, where they will remain through Monday morning before colder air can move back in from the west. Precipitation, mostly in the form of rain, will reach the coast Saturday afternoon and spread inland overnight. The core of the precipitation will remain stationary over the Delta through late Sunday night with up to an inch of liquid precipitation (rain) possible. There is some uncertainty in the precipitation type forecast, but strong southerlies and temperatures in the mid- to-upper 30s supports mostly rain for this event, though there may be a transition back to snow towards Sunday night as cold air moves in from the west. Stay tuned to the forecast for additional updates.
